name: Tech City Ventures
slogan: We build and scale technology ecosystems inclusively and collaboratively
description:
TCV is a collective of stakeholders – from innovators, data holders, industry, the public sector and citizens – building the world’s future tech ecosystems collaboratively. 

Founded by George Johnston, TCV acknowledges real global impact cannot be created by one company or team alone.

In little under 3 years, we have developed a team of 35+ talented individuals who’s worked with over 30 cities, 200+ high growth scale ups, 300+ C-level industry executives and delivered many successful private and public sector partnerships.

team.title: CEO
team.name: George Johnston
team.bioHtml: Accelerating sustainable innovation @Tech City Ventures • Founder @Nitrous @TechDotX @Momentum London @Incube @swiftscale • Worked at @Huddle

team.name: Ricardo Simard
team.bioHtml: 15+ years working at Microsoft, Accenture and Sky. Strong background in marketing, sales planning, consulting and entrepreneurship. Love starting new projects.

jobs.title: Full-Stack Developer
jobs.description:
WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR
A Full-Stack developer to work on various projects, in a full-time capacity, capable of understanding/designing the architecture of a product, developing, optimising and maintaining it.

THE WORK 
We are scaling multiple projects - initially focused on 1) API integration, 2) full-stack development and 3) system architecture.

YOUR EXPERTISE
ReactJS
Nodejs
Javascript
MongoDB
Python
Computer Science (or similar) degree

Would be an advantage:
Docker/Kubernetes
Linux knowledge
System architecture
Flask

YOUR COMPETENCIES
- Problem solving: You’re able to understand the product vision, and articulate solutions or workarounds (such as suggesting new timeframes, alternative features etc.)
- Intelligence: You learn quickly. You demonstrate an ability to quickly and proficiently understand and absorb new information. 
- Attention to detail: You never let important details slip through the cracks or derail a project. You accurately identify what constitutes important details.
- Persistence: You demonstrate tenacity and willingness to go the distance to get something done.
- Follow-through on commitments: You live up to verbal and written agreements.
- Honesty and integrity: You do not cut corners ethically. You earn trust and maintain confidences. You does what is right, and speak plainly and truthfully.
- Passionate about startups: Helping innovators to grow their ideas excites you.

jobs.title: Front End Developer
jobs.description:
Stellar multi-disciplinary front end developer required for an urgent freelance project, with many more projects to follow. 

This first project is focused on web and application design.

LIVE PROJECT INFO

We are looking for a front page redesign of a high traffic website. Following this, the rest of the website will be redesigned and at a later date, sister websites will also follow suit. 

This person will need to be available immediately for briefing and to get started on this project. They need to be London-based. 

This will be a three month, full-time contract, with the option to renew. 

The product is built on React, so knowledge would be advantageous. 

The ability to reproduce design sheets in PDF with CSS and CSS frameworks like LESS and Sass.

jobs.title: Junior UI Designer
jobs.description:
We’re looking for an experienced and ambitious Junior UX/UI Designer to support on the build and iteration of a set of products across the Tech City Ventures network of companies. 

You love taking complex ideas, workflows and concepts and turning them into user experiences that are efficient and that delight. You’ll delight in testing your designs and concepts on real users, and rapidly iterate designs based on user feedback. You’ll relish in being given a challenging problem and being given free rein to come with solutions. Rapid iteration and user-driven development are your friends.

DAY TO DAY, YOU'll BE:
- Participating in all phases of product development lifecycle, including product ideation and definition, strategy, UI design and user research and testing
- Creating sketches, site flows, wireframes and high-fidelity prototypes to tell compelling stories on all screen sizes
- Completing designs iteratively that meet business goals and requirements while maintaining and thoughtfully refining design patterns and UI standards
- Perpetually demonstrating expertise UI/UX design both in discussion and practice

WHAT THIS MEANS IN PRACTICE IS THAT YOU'LL:
- Gather and evaluate user requirements in collaboration with product managers and engineers
- Illustrate design ideas using storyboards, process flows and sitemaps
- Design graphic user interface elements, like menus, tabs and widgets
- Build page navigation buttons and search fields
- Develop UI mockups and prototypes that clearly illustrate how sites function and look like
- Create original graphic designs (e.g. images, sketches and tables)
- Prepare and present rough drafts to internal teams and key stakeholders
- Identify and troubleshoot UX problems (e.g. responsiveness)
- Conduct layout adjustments based on user feedback
- Adhere to style standards on fonts, colours and images

YOU'LL HAVE:
- Proven work experience as a UI/UX Designer or similar role
- A strong portfolio of work, specifically in product design, showcasing UX and visual skills
- Experience in designing a wide range of digital assets
- A good understanding of Typography, Composition, and Grid Systems
- Excellent visual design skills with sensitivity to user experience
- Uncanny strong user intuition with the desire to test those assumptions
- Basic knowledge of HTML and CSS
- BSc in Design, Computer Science or relevant field

Personal qualities that will help you succeed in this role include:
- The ability to thrive in highly collaborative, fluid, fast-paced open office environment whilst being able to grasp multiple product requirements with careful attention to detail
- Excellent interpersonal skills, confident, professional
- Ability to work on own initiative, but also seek assistance when required
- Demonstrate pride in your work, through high quality and accurate timely delivery
- Ability to organise and prioritise workload to ensure timescales are met
- Willingness to share knowledge and help junior team members develop

You should apply if:
- You’re passionate about building the best possible user experience, and you monitor your metrics to see whether you’re delivering
- You’re comfortable working in a technical team that deals with ambiguity every day

skills: Wireframing, Sketching, High Fidelity Mockups, User Research, Ideation, Presenting

jobs.title: Marketing Manager
jobs.description:
We’re looking for an experienced and ambitious Marketing Manager to take on marketing responsibilities across the Tech City Ventures network of companies. 

### **Who we are**
We're a London-based company that's building tech cities. Whether its creating a tool for citites to use to procure SMEs, or to bring the whole tech ecosystem together, or even build the actual infrastructure, we are there. 

What this means is that we're building multiple products, as well as working with clients - startups, enterprises and cities - and we need a tenacious individual with marketing skills to ensure that our marketing is doing a great job of promoting ourselves and our clients. 

### **Who you are**
You’ll have experience in several marketing disciplines and will be keen to try new approaches to get our messages out to our target audiences. You'll love words, design and analytics.

**Your key tasks and responsibilities will be:**
* Gather and distill business messaging and build this into all comms - from the website, to sales decks, to social media
* Creating content including social media, blog posts, 
* Generating press coverage through identifying story opportunities, building relationships with key journalists and selling stories in
* Optimising existing channels (e.g. through SEO, designing social media campaigns)
* Reviewing analytics from marketing channels and products, and using these insights to improve marketing activities
* Maintain a marketing calendar
* Coming up with creative ways to market Tech City Ventures

**For this role, we believe your starting point is:**
* At least 2 years' working in marketing roles
* Experience in content marketing
* Experience of copywriting for different audiences - B2B and B2C
* Experience of growing a marketing audience, and improving engagement metrics
* A background of working in the tech ecosystem
* Experience of working with product teams (bonus)

**Personal qualities that will help you succeed in this role include:**
* Excellent interpersonal skills, confident, professional
* Self-starter - ability to work on own initiative, but also seek assistance when required
* Demonstrate pride in your work, through high quality and accurate timely delivery
* Ability to organise and prioritise workload to ensure timescales are met
* Ability to work to tight deadlines
* Willingness to share knowledge 
* Big picture-aware, balancing business and audience needs at all times

**You should apply if:**
* You’ve delivered marketing campaigns that you're proud of before
* You’re passionate about building the best possible engagement with audiences, and you monitor your metrics to see whether you’re delivering
* You’re comfortable working in a fast-paced business
* You’re passionate about taking ideas and exhausting all of the opportunities they present

jobs.title: Venture Architect (Nitrous)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
ABOUT NITROUS

A Tech City Ventures company, Nitrous is a London-based SME that builds co-created solutions that address city challenges. We believe that existing data, technologies and expertise can be combined to take new solutions from idea to impact in a matter of months.

Born out of a desire to see industry, government and SMEs come together to solve key problems, Nitrous has a reputation as a connector, city co-creation advisory and an organisation that can identify fast-growth, viable and scale-able impact tech solutions.

We bring together insights into the way public sector organisations, corporate actors and tech SMEs operate, and have developed a model of co-creation to affect the next wave of change.

ABOUT THE ROLE

The Nitrous Venture Architect is a key hire for the business as we implement this model of co-creation. This individual will be in charge of product and proposition development and day-to-day management of a Nitrous venture and be the key point of contact for the lead partner funding the project as well as the public and private sector partners.

RESPONSIBILITIES

As a Venture Architect you will use your skills to:

Innovate

  • Support the development and delivery of co-creation programmes under the leadership of the Venture Manager;
  • Support development of business cases for co-creation including ecosystem and competitor research and analysis;
  • Collaborate with the public sector counterparts, as well as partners and investors, to define a minimum viable business (proof of concept) build;
  • Support the development and execution of commercial launch and go-to-market strategy of the venture;
  • Continually develop and finetune financial model for venture.

Incubate

  • Collaborate with multidisciplinary teams to ensure that product development and delivery is aligned with the launch and value scheme of the new venture;
  • Adopt a lean start-up approach to building a minimum viable business and go-to-market strategy;
  • Support recruitment of key team roles and definition of responsibilities across work streams;
  • Support identification of required partners for regulatory requirements or support needs;
  • Deliver reports on key performance indicators of the venture;
  • Oversee newly established venture teams to execute the organisational staffing, product or service development and business build efforts.

Commercialisation

  • Support the execution of agreed go-to-market plans;
  • Support the preparation and negotiation of contractual agreements with suppliers, partners and regulatory bodies;
  • Ensure the venture team is consistently synthesising customer and market feedback to recommend opportunities for change or improvement in subsequent releases;
  • Mobilise follow-on release plans
  • Lead the joint venture scale-up process to deliver outsized returns to investors.

Partner Management

  • Engage directly with public sector counterparts and venture partners to ensure smooth delivery of the co-creation programme and eventually joint venture;
  • Contribute to the development of thought leadership across a range of emerging business, technology and design topics;
  • Facilitate co-creation sessions with multi-disciplinary public and private sector teams.

Leadership:

  • Coordinate partners to ensure smooth delivery of MVP;
  • Work closely with the Venture Manager and CEO to execute business strategy;
  • Support design and implementation of processes that ensure the business is scalable;
  • Build a team.

You will:

  • Have an entrepreneurial background and a passion for the problem the venture is attempting to solve;
  • Have extensive experience in product management (3+ years);
  • Have extensive experience in senior stakeholder management;
  • Have a background in problem-solving and project management roles, (management consulting advantageous);
  • Hold a bachelor’s degree;
  • Hold a master’s degree (postgraduate, MBA or equivalent study) (advantageous);
  • Have experience working in a high-pressure environment.
